title: Great Places: Portland by Shawn & Raina
name: Great Places: Portland by Shawn & Raina
description:
A Map by Shawnbusse

Great Places and Restuarants in Portland Oregon

properties.name: Apizza Scholls
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 4741 SE Hawthorne Blvd. PortlandFresh ingredients, no frills, crust that takes 24 hours to prepare. They often run out of crusts before they close. I would get the margherita pizza. No need for meat because the flavor is so good.

properties.name: Brentwood Park - Volleyball
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse  Outdoor Grass Volleyball on Sundays (weather permitting) at 12:00 (general time)

properties.name: Bridgeport Ale House
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse3632 Se Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, ORSmall local brew pub. Good food, good beer

properties.description: Posted by Jake 1801 NE Broadway, Portland, ORweekend breakfast joint

properties.description: Posted by Jason 2924 E Burnside St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Jim and Patty's Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Doublezy  5015 NE Fremont St, Portland, OR...for taking the time to sit down and chat with me that day over coffee and chai (I know you are incredibly busy). I loved your stories about NYC and MTV. You were one of the first people I met in Portland.

properties.name: Junior's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle    1742 SE 12TH Ave, Portland, OR 97214Get breakfast and lunch. Quality food. You better get their early on the weekends or wait. I always get the Yummy Waffle. They only take cash or checks.

properties.name: Ken's Artisan Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Transfairusa  338 Northwest 21st Avenue, Portland, OR, 97209fair trade

properties.name: Laurelhurst Movie Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  2735 east burnside st portland orCheap good movies showing nightly. Special screenings go on all the time, and they serve beer and wine with pizzicatto pizza.

properties.name: Laurelhurst Theater
properties.description: Posted by System  2735 E Burnside St, Portland, ORLaurelhurst Theater (503) 232-5511

properties.name: Le Bistro Montage
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   301 Se Morrison St, Portland, ORThis place has been around for a while. I believe this is their second location. They have mac and cheese, oyster shooters, wine, beer, cocktails, and desserts. They are open late (4am Fri-Sat). This has been a standby whenever folks come to visit from out of town. But I must say the last few times I have been here the food was not very good. Fluke?

properties.name: Mio Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Phineasbarnes 2271 NW Johnson St, Portland, OR, 97210Mio Sushi 503-221-1469

properties.name: Mio Sushi Hawthorne
properties.description: Posted by System3962 Southeast Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OR, 97214Mio Sushi Hawthorne 503-230-6981

properties.name: Mississippi Pizza Pub
properties.description: Posted by Beto 3552 North Mississippi Avenue, Portland, OR, 97227Mississippi Pizza Pub 503-288-3231

properties.name: Monsoon Thai Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse 4236 N Mississippi Ave portland oregonGreat cheap Thai food in North Portland. Phone: 503-280-7087.

properties.name: Muu Muu's
properties.description: Posted by Sayuminice drinks & food modern environment

properties.name: Nature Bake
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse 1170 NE 63rd Ave, Portland, OR 97213Great local bakery - home of Dave\'s Killer Blues Bread and the BEST ginger meltaways you\'ll ever eat. Get the day-olds. They are worth every penny.

properties.name: Nostrana
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1401 Southeast Morrison Street, Portland, OR, 97214Get the wood-fired Margherita with Arugula pizza. The crusts are thin and chewy. They make their own sausage. They don\'t slop on a bunch of crappy ingredients. I typically go a little later to avoid waiting and crowds.

properties.name: Pasta Bangs
properties.description: Posted by System3950 N Mississippi Ave, Portland, ORPasta Bangs (503) 287-2782

properties.name: Pied Cow
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse3244 SE Belmont St portland oregon"A little bit of hippie and a little bit of charm make for a neighborhood cafe with lasting appeal" Great desserts, fantastic in the summer (outdoor patio)

properties.name: Red Fig
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse4537 NE Freemont St, Portland or 97213Great, affordable bento with a twist. Exceptional ingredients, fair price, quick service. Outdoor seating

properties.name: Sapphire Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse  5008 SE Hawthorne Blvd portland orSapphire Hotel is a sexy, candlelit bar in the lobby of what was once a traveler\'s hotel and local brothel. Excellent hang out if you want just a little bit of food and a great atmosphere. Don\'t get me wrong - this place is GREAT for dinner, but the portions are small, though incredibly flavorful. Well worth the trip!

properties.name: Saucebox
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 214 Sw Broadway, Portland, ORSince 1995, Saucebox has provided Portland amazing pan asian inspired cuisine, cocktails, and nightlife. With the additional dining room added on new years of 2005, there is even more room for you to enjoy.

properties.name: Stumptown Coffee Roasters - SE Belmont
properties.description: Posted by Kenefsky 3356 SE Belmont Street portland, orGreat coffee, free wifi, cool muisc, hip location. My virtual office.

properties.name: Tabla Mediterranean Bistro
properties.description: Posted by System 200 Northeast 28th Avenue, Portland, OR, 97232Tabla Mediterranean Bistro

properties.name: Thanh THAO Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse 4005 Southeast Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OR, 97214Thanh THAO Restaurant

properties.name: The Courts at Beaverton
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse14523 SW Millikan Way beverton OrThe Courts has 6 court areas that can configure 6 Volleyball courts or 2 volleyball and 4 Basketball or any combination as needed. Each court is netted off for its own area and balls will not go into other courts. The entire courts area is all high quality hardwood maple floor that is easy on the legs and great for training and playing. The courts have open play on Friday nights, 7:00. The play is usually VERY ADVANCED. Not recommended for the beginning player.

properties.name: The Good Foot
properties.description: Posted by Kaptinqwin  2845 SE Stark St. Portland, OR 97214pinball, pool, art, music downstairs, good beer and alcohol. i strongly recommend the chicken strips and the salmon burger. watch out for pinball gangs!

properties.name: The Spare Room
properties.description: Posted by Scottysouling4830 NE 42nd Ave, Portland, 97218 The best place in Portland to go to see old people dancing to live music. I once saw some hipsters playing strip poker at a table next to mine.

properties.name: Tuk Tuk Thai
properties.description: Posted by System4239 Ne Fremont St, Portland, ORTuk Tuk Thai (503) 282-0456

properties.name: W.C. Winks Hardware
properties.description: Posted by Garth200 SE Stark St, Portland, 97214 all the bin pulls and machine brass hinges you\'ll ever need. yankee screwdrivers too!

properties.name: a pretty cool dog park
properties.description: Posted by Tooldiva  My dog is an avid squirrel chaser, so I prefer to bring her to a dog park that is fenced so she can have the experience of running as free as the wind. Such is the urban pooch experience. Normandale Park is great because it\'s pretty big, has lots of trees, and isn\'t a former toxic waste dump like the fenced dog areas at Delta Park and Gabriel Park. I have also met a few very nice humans in my time at Normandale who are courteous and responsible with their pets, as well as being good conversationalists. Portland still has yet to have a really great dog park like the one in Ashland or the Dr. Jose Rizal Park in Seattle. But for the time being, this one does quite well.

properties.name: clarklewis
properties.description: Posted by Malachi 1001 SE Water, Portland, ORSuper hipster industrial PNW Italian food. Love the pasta.

properties.name: crazy former bank that's now an oil painting depository
properties.description: Posted by ScottysoulingNo explanation. But some nice old guys let me inside to look around.

properties.name: noble rot
properties.description: Posted by Paigesan old portland staple in a new portland location.
